title: Concrete-to-Abstract Approach for Geometry and Algebra Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics fundamentals (arithmetic, basic geometry comprehension)
context.additional_context: Providing online content that utilizes concrete examples connected to learners' daily experiences within a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain geometric properties through concrete manipulative activities (e.g., virtual paper folding) and convert them into abstract formulas.
In algebraic problem situations, learners can transition concrete examples (e.g., daily object calculations) into mathematical expressions with ≥80% accuracy.
Using concrete-abstract connection strategies, learners achieve ≥30% improvement in performance compared to pre-assessments when solving geometry and algebra problems.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
